name: Dee D. Jackson
description: '''Dee D. Jackson''' (born '''Deirdre Elaine Cozier''', 15 July 1954, [[Oxford]], England) is an English singer and musician who was primarily associated with the [[space disco]] genre. In the 1970s, she worked as a film producer in [[Munich]] before moving into music, working with [[Giorgio Moroder]], [[Jimmy McShane]] and [[Keith Forsey]]. She is perhaps best known for "[[Automatic Lover]]" (1978), the [[lead single]] from her [[concept album]] ''Cosmic Curves'' (1978).
